results.title: Lolita
results.creator_credit: Adrian Lyne, Joel B Michaels, Mario Kassar and Lolita Productions Inc
results.brief_description: Following in the footsteps of Stanley Kubrick, Adrian Lyne brings to the screen the second film version of Vladimir Nabokov’s controversial 1955 novel “Lolita”. “Lolita” follows the exploits of bachelor Humbert Humbert (Jeremy Irons) who marries a jaded widow (Melanie Griffith), whom he secretly loathes, in order to get closer to his object of obsession, her teenage daughter, Lolita (Dominique Swain). Humbert’s obsession for Lolita takes them both to some dark sexual and psychological places. Following his wife’s timely death Humbert seizes the opportunity to take Lolita on a cross-country journey - one that tracks the sexual progression of the relationship between step-father and daughter. Having majored in erotic cinema in the past (Nine and a half weeks, Fatal attraction, Indecent proposal, Unfaithful) Adrian Lyne is well placed to deliver the sexual fantasies of Humbert to the big screen. Jeremy Irons is a nervous and manipulative Humbert, suffering guilt for his sexual fantasies even as he exploits Lolita in order to realise them. Dominique Swain is well cast as Lolita - the young nubile nymphette, only faintly aware of the intensity of her sexual power over the hapless Humbert. Original score by Ennio Morricone.

results.title: Top gun
results.creator_credit: Tony Scott, Don Simpson, Jerry Bruckheimer and Paramount Pictures
results.brief_description: Directed by Tony Scott, “Top gun” was the film that catapulted Tom Cruise into mega stardom. Cruise plays Lieutenant Pete ‘Maverick’ Mitchell, a hotshot navy pilot, with no respect for rules, regulations or authority. Maverick is training at the Top Gun Naval Flying School, where he is out to prove himself to be the best of the best, at all costs. Maverick flies recklessly, but with skill, co-piloted by his best mate Nick ‘Goose’ Bradshaw (Anthony Edwards). Maverick is somewhat haunted by his father’s legacy, also a pilot, whose error whilst flying may have caused his own death and that of others. At the school Maverick encounters competition to be the top pilot from Lieutenant Tom ‘Iceman’ Kazanski (Val Kilmer) who mocks Maverick’s braggadocio and family history. Simultaneously Maverick is attracted to an instructor at the school, Charlie (Kelly McGillis) and is forced to face his personal demons in light of the strengthening feelings for her. “Top gun” features several daredevil flying scenes and has a sub-plot involving a run-in (mid-air) with some rogue Russian pilots. “Top gun” was the highest grossing film of 1986 in the United States. Also starring Tom Skerritt, as a flight instructor, and Meg Ryan as the Goose’s wife.

results.title: In dreams
results.creator_credit: Neil Jordan, Stephen Woolley and NBCUniversal
results.brief_description: Claire (Annette Bening), a children’s book illustrator, lives in a large, rustic New England home in idyllic Massachusetts with her daughter, Rebecca, and husband, Paul (Aidan Quinn), an airline-pilot. At the same time a serial killer threatens the safety of young girls in the community, Claire begins experiencing horrible and nightmarish dreams. The fabric of her dreams not only resembles her illustration work but also the terrible events occurring in the local community. In a truly unnerving twist, it’s revealed that Claire’s unconscious is possessed by the killer. As reality and the dream world collapse, tragedy, violence and confusion ensues. Confined to a mental institution and treated by the ineffectual Doctor Silverman (Stephen Rea), Claire - under the influence of Vivian Thompson (Robert Downey Jr.) - escapes and faces her maligned alterego head on. In a splendid closing montage of water imagery, Claire ultimately finds harmony, peace and tranquillity. By acclaimed director Neil Jordan, “In Dreams” is a dark and unnerving film that gives full and rich exploration to the theme of the unconscious as a pool of mixed desires and impulses. Also features excellent cinematography by Darius Khondji.

results.title: Eyes wide shut
results.creator_credit: Stanley Kubrick, Hobby Films, Pole Star and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: Stanley Kubrick’s last film is a metaphysical exploration of fantasy and marriage. Based loosely on the Austrian novel “Traumnovelle” by Arthur Schnitzler, which was itself based on Schnitzler’s experience of Freudian psychoanalysis, ‘Eyes wide shut’ begins at an elaborate ball where we are introduced to Dr. William Harford and his wife, Alice. A haute-bourgeois contemporary couple, Bill and Alice, seem to have everything going for them: wealth, health, a beautiful child, security. But on returning back from the party, Alice, after smoking marijuana, tells her husband of a sexual fantasy involving a Navy Lieutenant. This fantasy precipitates a crisis of jealousy and identity for the Doctor who then takes to the New York streets on a nightmare journey of the soul which culminates in a baroque ritualistic orgy. Recreating New York City on sound stages in London has allowed Kubrick to re-imagine the city as a swirling metropolis of the unconscious, where Bill’s encounters with lascivious shop-owners, HIV positive prostitutes and malevolent arch-capitalists can be read as either a commentary on contemporary consumer indulgence and excess, or as manifestations of the doctor’s feverish imagination. In many respects ‘Eyes wide shut’ can be read as a road movie where instead of taking us through geographical space and time, Kubrick involves us in a journey across the human psyche and imagination. The film itself heavily divided audiences on its release. By attaching his cool distanced filmmaking techniques to a torrid psychoanalytic phantasm about marriage and sex, Kubrick has created something unique in cinema history: a melodrama which is in fact an anti-love story, a Sirkean study of love as re-imagined by Ingmar Bergman. Whatever one’s opinion about ‘Eyes wide shut’, what is undeniable is the supreme confidence of Kubrick’s filmmaking, both visually and in terms of the rich, mesmerising soundtrack. The film stars the then real-life married couple, Tom Cruise and Nicole Kidman.

results.title: Lolita [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Stanley Kubrick, James B. Harris, Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer and Seven Arts Production
results.brief_description: Adapted for the screen by Vladimir Nabokov from his controversial novel about a middle-aged man driven by a furious passion for a ‘nymphet’. James Mason plays the tragic middle-aged professor Humbert Humbert who marries his widowed landlady (Shelley Winters) to be near her teenaged daughter Lolita (Sue Lyon). Peter Sellers plays the eccentric playwright Quilty who wants to hijack Lolita for himself.

results.title: Chasing Amy [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Kevin Smith, Scott Mosier, Miramax Films and View Askew Productions
results.brief_description: The concluding chapter of Kevin Smith’s New Jersey Trilogy, “Chasing Amy” is a comedy about Holden, a successful comic-book creator, whose life takes a turn when he falls madly in love with Alyssa, a fellow artist. The first major shock awaiting Holden is Alyssa’s apparent lesbian orientation. The second one comes after the two develop a strong friendship, and Alyssa decides not to limit her chances of love to women only. The two begin an affair, despite Holden’s nagging doubts about her promiscuous past. Cast includes Ben Affleck, Joey Lauren Adams, Jason Lee, Dwight Ewell, Jason Mewes and Kevin Smith.

results.title: Xanadu
results.creator_credit: Robert Greenwald, Lawrence Gordon and Universal Pictures
results.brief_description: Disco, rollerskates, ELO and 1940s meets 1980s courtesy of Olivia Newton-John and Gene Kelly combined in this cult, kitsch, musical fantasy. Kira (Olivia Newton-John) is a Greek muse despatched to Earth to inspire young artist, Sonny Malone (Michael Beck), realise his dream of starting up a disco rollerskating rink called Xanadu. She teams him up with Danny McGuire (Gene Kelly), an ex big club band member and former recipient of Kira’s magical influence. Sonny and Danny merge their styles and generations as Kira and Sonny challenge the laws of nature by falling in love. From this threadbare plot emerges a time capsule of 1980s music, fashion, and sensibility that has been simultaneously loved and loathed by viewers.

results.title: Three colours white = Trois coleurs blanc (DVD)
results.creator_credit: Krzysztof Kieslowski, Marin Karmitz, CAB, Canal+, CED, France 3 Cinema and MK2 Productions
results.brief_description: The “Three Colours” trilogy is loosely inspired by the ideals of the French Revolution: Blue for freedom, Red for fraternity and White for equality. White also represents the hero’s marriage, the Polish winter and an alabaster bust that threads through the narrative, its significance unexplained. Karol is a Polish hairdresser in Paris. When his French wife divorces him he is left without money or possessions, except for a suitcase full of diplomas, a comb and a paper. A compatriot smuggles him home and his luck improves. Things have changed in the new democratic Poland. Janos becomes a successful businessman but must still resolve his relationship with his wife. Stars Zbigniew Zamachowski and Julie Delpy. Polish and French dialogue with English subtitles. Winner of the Silver Bear award for Best Director, Berlin, 1994.

results.title: Secrets & lies = Secrets and lies [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Mike Leigh, Simon Channing-Williams, CiBy 2000 and Thin Man
results.brief_description: Cynthia is an unmarried factory worker who lives in a state of siege with her perpetually enraged daughter, Roxanne. In sharp contrast, Cynthia’s brother, Maurice, runs a thriving photographic studio and works hard to provide a luxury home for his neurotic, childless wife. Meanwhile, an adopted young black woman, Hortense, is scouring London for her real mother, who, she learns to her shock, is white. Emotions run high as everyone’s secrets are exposed. Both hilarious and heartbreaking, Mike Leigh’s critically acclaimed box office sensation is a superb film. Stars Timothy Spall, Brenda Blethyn, Phyllis Logan, Mariane Jean-Baptiste and Claire Rushbrook. Written by Mike Leigh. (Awards: Palme D’Or and Best Actress Cannes 1996)

In sharp contrast, Cynthia’s brother, Maurice, runs a thriving photographic studio and works hard to provide a luxury home for his neurotic, childless wife. Meanwhile, an adopted young black woman, Hortense, is scouring London for her real mother, who, she learns to her shock, is white. Emotions run high as everyone’s secrets are exposed. Both hilarious and heartbreaking, Mike Leigh’s critically acclaimed box office sensation is a superb film. Stars Timothy Spall, Brenda Blethyn, Phyllis Logan, Mariane Jean-Baptiste and Claire Rushbrook. Written by Mike Leigh. (Awards: Palme D’Or and Best Actress Cannes 1996)

results.title: Divorcing Jack
results.creator_credit: David Caffrey, Robert Cooper, BBC, Scala and Winchester Films
results.brief_description: Starkey (David Thewlis) is an Irish journalist, known for his cynicism and satirical wit, who nurses a serious drinking problem. When Starkey is kicked out of the marital home for infidelity, he falls into bed with the beautiful Margaret, whose ex-boyfriend is connected with the IRA. When Margaret turns up dead Starkey is the number one suspect and is forced to go on the lam, with several factions, including the police and the IRA after his scalp. An upcoming election is somehow linked with the murder and as Starkey evades capture (with a lame disguise and the help of a nurse who also works as a nun-o-gram), he struggles to figure out how the two are connected. “Divorcing Jack” has plenty of bloodshed, beatings, car chases, torture and swearing as well as a convoluted plot involving various terrorist factions. A black comedy that takes a cynical view of the machinations of politics, the press and the Northern Ireland peace process, “Divorcing Jack” has a script riddled with deft one-liners, all delivered in a thick Irish brogue.
